alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 18 at 7:19PM EDT until June 20 at 11:07AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is expected. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Skowhegan. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 35,000.0 cfs, Flooding begins at campgrounds in Skowhegan. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EDT Sunday the flow was 36,093.0 cfs. - Recent Activity...The maximum river flow in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM EDT Sunday was 36,093.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 44,050.0 cfs just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood flow is 35,000.0 cfs. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
